data.title: GDRI :: Game Developer Research Institute
data.text:
From Game Developer Research Institute

Jump to: navigation, search

ATTENTION: This entry is a WORK IN PROGRESS

This entry is not finished. Please use with caution.

Sculptured Software was an American game developer that was founded by Bryan Brandenburg, George Meteos, and Peter Adams. The company was known for porting arcade games to home consoles. In the NES days, Paul Webb was the only sound designer for Sculptured Software. Acclaim later bought out Sculptured Software in 1995 but closed down a few years later in 2002 due to financial problems.
